newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: NatMut shares surge on Axa China licence.
newsitem.headline: NatMut shares surge on Axa China licence.

text.p: Shares in insurance office National Mutual Holdings Ltd surged to a record high A$2.08 on Friday after it confirmed its parent, Axa-UAP, had been advised it would receive a licence to operate in China.
"They have taken a nice bounce this morning after Axa apparently has the chance to open a life business in China," said the head dealer of one investment bank.

National Mutual, commenting on earlier reports that a China licence would be granted, said the advice to its parent was verbal, adding that both the Australian company and Axa-UAP, which owns 51 percent of National Mutual, had applied separately for China licences.
By noon (0200 GMT), National Mutual shares were 11 cents higher at A$2.05 on heavy turnover of 8.9 million shares.
